intro: Sebastiania brachypoda, commonly known as the dwarf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
